page_analysis.text_content:
Attic
space &
equivalen-
cies

Voluminous spaces in a
structure contribute to
the mass even if these
areas are not used
or described in the
floor plan. The 2nd &
3rd floor equivalency
addresses how these
areas count toward the
gross floor area.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

16

Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross
floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

In Fig 11 below, the highlighted areas count as follows:

• Area A of this 3rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head
clearance and counts as 3rd floor area.
• Area B of this 2rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head
clearance and is included in the count of the, more obvious, 2nd
floor area.

Fig 11 Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

Note: 500 sf of unusable attic
space may be exempted for
Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Note:
Measurements are
from top of floor to
underside of the rafter

Underside of
pical)

oor

1st floor

visual_elements.description: A cross-section diagram of a multi-story building, likely a house, illustrating how attic, closet, and perimeter spaces are measured for floor area. It shows a 1st floor, a 2nd floor, and an attic level. Key areas are labeled 'A' (in the attic) and 'B' (on the 2nd floor, possibly a closet or sloped ceiling area). A vertical measurement of 5' is indicated from the floor to the underside of the rafter on the 2nd floor. Stairs are visible connecting the floors. The diagram also points to '1st floor' and 'underside of rafter'. There's a 'CC' label near the stairs on the 2nd floor.
visual_elements.location: Bottom half of the right page

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum head clearance for counting floor area
Exempted unusable attic space for historic homes

subheadings: On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.
In Fig 11 below, the highlighted areas count as follows:
Note: 500 sf of unusable attic space may be exempted for Category 1 & 2 historic homes.
Note: Measurements are from top of floor to underside of the rafter
sections: Voluminous spaces in a structure contribute to the mass even if these areas are not used or described in the floor plan. The 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency addresses how these areas count toward the gross floor area.
Area A of this 3rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and counts as 3rd floor area.
Area B of this 2rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and is included in the count of the, more obvious, 2nd floor area.

additional_notes: Page number '16' is present at the bottom left.
The text 'Underside of pical)' appears to be a truncated or misaligned label for 'underside of rafter' in the diagram.
The text 'oor' appears to be a truncated or misaligned label for 'floor' in the diagram.
